title: Capacitor - change when inserting a dielectric

content.question: Capacitor <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> has twice the capacitance of Capacitor <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>. Both capacitors are initially filled with air. Then Capacitor <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> has a dielectric inserted between its plates with a dielectric constant of <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>. What is the ratio of the capacitance of Capacitor <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> to the capacitance of Capacitor <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> after the dielectric was inserted?

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
